title: Berlin's Top Ten must-see tourism places
text:
Berlin's Top Ten must-see tourism places   31, 2015 eTN   
Berlin is the place to be. In their popular 36 Hours travel feature, the New York Times list the Palast Berlin as the only theatre among the top 10 must-see places in the German capital. Their verdict on the Grand Show: ëTHE WYLD leaves you breathless and wanting more.í 
A great honor for Berlin's most-visited Show Palace with its 500,000 guests each year. Friedrichstadt-Palast, or Palast Berlin for short, is Europe's biggest and most modern show palace with the largest theatre stage in the world. London-based THE SUNDAY TIMES called it ëLas Vegas in Berlin. 
With 11.9 million visitors and 28.7 million overnight stays, last year was the most successful year for tourism in Berlin's history. The multicultural metropolis embraces its guests with a vast spectrum of glamour and vibrant culture. Since the city offers so many opportunities, it often seems impossible to choose. 
Kristen Kish, one of the hottest newcomers on the U.S. haute cuisine scene, and Kyle Marino, former American football player and TV commentator, were wowed by impressive scenes both backstage and in the breathtaking hit production. 
THE WYLD: : Over a hundred performers in 500 costumes take you on a wild ride that draws inspiration from Fritz Langís sci-fi surrealism, the naughty burlesque of the musical Cabaret and the beat bunkers of the Berlin rave sceneÖ THE WYLD leaves you breathless and wanting more.í 
Along with the Palast, the ë10 Must-See Places in Berlin include the Alte Nationalgalerie, the roof terrace and dome of the Reichstag building, the 25Hours Hotel Bikini Berlin, the Berlin Cathedral, Prinzessinneng‰rten, Fernsehturm, Markthalle 9, East Side Gallery and the Brandenburg Gate.
